decks.notes: This BUG Midrange deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze, Force of Will, Stifle, and Hymn to Tourach, while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Tombstalker to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck utilizes efficient removal like Go for the Throat and Snuff Out, along with versatile card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. Engineered Explosives provides additional answers to threats, while Sylvan Library helps with card advantage. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and can disrupt opponents with Wasteland.

The deck aims to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using cards like Show and Tell and Lim-DÃ»l's Vault. It also utilizes Doomsday to set up a winning combination of cards in the library. The deck includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. The inclusion of Stifle and Dark Ritual adds flexibility and speed to the deck's overall strategy. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and win the game quickly through its intricate combo interactions.

The main idea of this deck is to rapidly build up a board state of enchantments, utilizing cards like Argothian Enchantress and Enchantress's Presence to draw additional cards. With cards like Sterling Grove for protection and Utopia Sprawl for ramp, the deck aims to quickly assemble a lock with cards like City of Solitude and Solitary Confinement. The combo potential is further enhanced with cards like Replenish and Sigil of the Empty Throne to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also has some disruption elements with cards like Blood Moon and Runed Halo to control the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently through cards like Cabal Ritual and Dark Ritual to cast a high number of spells in a single turn. The goal is to use cards like Infernal Tutor and Ad Nauseam to draw into key combo pieces, such as Tendrils of Agony, and win the game by casting multiple spells and dealing lethal damage. The deck also includes hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The mana acceleration provided by Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal allows for explosive turns and fast wins.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Goblin creatures. Utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to put Goblins into play for free or at instant speed, this deck aims to flood the board with powerful Goblin creatures such as Goblin Piledriver and Siege-Gang Commander. By utilizing cards like Gempalm Incinerator and Goblin Ringleader to maintain card advantage and deal with threats, the deck seeks to maintain pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage through the use of Gaea's Cradle and mana acceleration. The deck aims to utilize powerful creatures such as Knight of the Reliquary and Tarmogoyf alongside removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to control the board. Additionally, cards like Mangara of Corondor and Quirion Ranger provide additional utility and ways to interact with the opponent. The deck's key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently controlling the game and applying pressure with strong creatures.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with early aggression using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Wild Nacatl, and Grim Lavamancer. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and disruption from cards like Swords to Plowshares and Qasali Pridemage. Additionally, the deck benefits from land synergy with Knight of the Reliquary and Terravore, providing a versatile and powerful strategy that can quickly close out games. The deck's manabase is optimized for consistency and includes powerful lands like Wasteland and Horizon Canopy to further support its aggressive game plan.

This zoo aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Wild Nacatl early on, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly while controlling the board with cards like Grim Lavamancer and Qasali Pridemage. Knight of the Reliquary helps to fetch key lands like Horizon Canopy and Gaddock Teeg can disrupt certain strategies. The deck also includes burn spells like Chain Lightning and Price of Progress to close out games.

This control deck utilizes a combination of counterspells, card selection, and the Counterbalance-Top combo to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing board control. Trinket Mage and Vendilion Clique provide additional utility and disruption, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers card advantage and a win condition. The deck aims to control the board through counter magic and removal like Swords to Plowshares, using Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top of the library and counterbalance to counter spells of the same converted mana cost.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with aggressive Goblin creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Using cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to cheat out creatures, along with cards like Goblin Chieftain and Goblin Warchief to give them a boost, the deck aims to deal damage fast and effectively. With removal options like Warren Weirding and Gempalm Incinerator, the deck can also handle threats from the opponent while maintaining pressure. The mana base is focused on supporting the aggressive game plan with lands that provide both red and black mana.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana through artifacts, such as Mox Opal and Grim Monolith, to bring out powerful creatures like Wurmcoil Engine and Blightsteel Colossus. It also utilizes cards like Voltaic Key and Metalworker to generate additional value and control the board with cards like Lodestone Golem and Sundering Titan. The deck can also use cards like Goblin Welder and Crucible of Worlds to recur artifacts and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful artifacts.

This deck revolves around using Painter's Servant to change all cards in the opponent's library to a single color, then using Grindstone to mill their entire deck with one activation. It also utilizes artifact tutors like Imperial Recruiter and Trinket Mage to find key combo pieces like Lion's Eye Diamond and Auriok Salvagers. The deck is able to control the board and protect its combo with counterspells like Force of Will, while also having access to card draw and recursion with cards like Brainstorm and Academy Ruins.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful board presence through aggressive mana ramping and efficient creatures, such as Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary, supported by powerful spells like Natural Order and Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and versatile aggro strategy, utilizing cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Mother of Runes for added protection and utility. The inclusion of cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Sylvan Library provide additional consistency and card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and adapt to different situations.

The deck focuses on using powerful creatures like Emrakul and Progenitus to quickly overwhelm the opponent through the use of Show and Tell. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will to protect the combo, the deck aims to efficiently ramp into its big threats with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise. Additionally, the deck can find its key creatures with Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, providing alternative paths to victory if the Show and Tell plan is disrupted.

The deck focuses on quickly playing creatures like Lotus Cobra and Noble Hierarch to ramp up mana and pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Rhox War Monk. It also includes disruption cards like Daze and Force of Will to control the game and protect its threats. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth, Knight-Errant to generate card advantage and provide additional threats. The inclusion of versatile cards like Green Sun's Zenith and utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland help provide flexibility and answer various threats from the opponent.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using efficient removal spells to control the board while dealing damage quickly. The key concept is to build a strong board presence early with creatures like Tarmogoyf and Knight of the Reliquary, supported by mana ramp from Noble Hierarch. This allows the deck to pressure the opponent and close out the game before they can establish their own game plan. The addition of cards like Sylvan Library and Green Sun's Zenith provide card advantage and additional threats to outvalue the opponent.
